segments.en: And today we're bringing you the sequel of I'm Sorry I Love You.
segments.cn: 今天我们带来《对不起，我爱你》的续集。

segments.en: I guess a lot of our listeners enjoyed the first part.
segments.cn: 我想我们的很多听众都喜欢第一部分。

segments.en: And since it was such a romantic hit dialogue and hit, we're bringing part two.
segments.cn: 由于它是如此浪漫的对话和热门，我们带来了第二部分。

segments.en: So it's even more romantic and I'm sure everyone is going to find some great and useful language in it.
segments.cn: 所以这更加浪漫，我相信每个人都会在其中找到一些很棒和有用的语言。

segments.en: We've got language that we use to talk about dates.
segments.cn: 我们有用来谈论约会的语言。

segments.en: So useful language for when you're going on a date.
segments.cn: 所以这是在约会时非常有用的语言。

segments.en: Well, before we look at this date language, let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 好吧，在我们看这个约会语言之前，让我们第一次听听对话。

segments.en: I'm so relieved that your ankle wasn't broken.
segments.cn: 我真松了一口气，你的脚踝没有骨折。

segments.en: I feel just awful about this whole thing.
segments.cn: 我对这整个事情感到非常糟糕。

segments.en: I want to make it up to you.
Let me take you out to dinner tonight, my treat.
Thank you for such a lovely evening.
segments.cn: 谢谢你度过如此美好的夜晚。

segments.en: The food was amazing and I had a great time.
segments.cn: 食物很美味，我度过了愉快的时光。

segments.en: I wish this night would never end.
segments.cn: 我希望这个夜晚永远不会结束。

segments.en: There's something that I have to tell you.
I woke up today thinking that this would be just like any other day.
segments.cn: 我今天醒来时以为这只是普通的一天。

segments.en: The twist of fate brought us together.
segments.cn: 命运的转折让我们相遇。

segments.en: I crashed into your life and you into mine.
segments.cn: 我闯入了你的生活，你也闯入了我的。

segments.en: And this may sound crazy, but I'm falling in love with you, Veronica.
segments.cn: 这听起来可能很疯狂，但我爱上你了，Veronica。

segments.en: It really sounds like they're falling in love.
segments.cn: 听起来他们真的在坠入爱河。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a really romantic thing that's going on right now.
segments.cn: 是的，现在发生的事情真的很浪漫。

segments.en: But there was some really useful words here, so why don't we take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 但这里有一些非常有用的词汇，所以我们来看看语言要点。

segments.en: Today we have three words for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 今天我们有三个词作为语言要点。

segments.en: And the first one is relieved.
So we have some great examples on how we use relieved and I'm really sure you can understand the meaning from the sentences.
segments.cn: 我们有一些很好的例子来说明我们如何使用“松了一口气”，我相信你能从句子中理解其含义。

segments.en: They were relieved to hear that the company would not be making any layoffs.
segments.cn: 他们听到公司不会裁员时松了一口气。

segments.en: I'm so relieved to hear your voice.
segments.cn: 我很高兴听到你的声音。

segments.en: I was relieved is like a happy or relaxed feeling that you get if you avoid something bad, right?
segments.cn: “松了一口气”就像是避免了坏事后感到快乐或放松的感觉，对吧？

segments.en: I'm so relieved that didn't happen.
segments.cn: 我真松了一口气，没发生那件事。
现在是我们的第二个词。

segments.en: So when you ask someone to pick you up, you're saying basically... Come and get me.
segments.cn: 所以当你让某人接你时，你基本上是在说……来接我。

segments.en: Okay, so let's let's give a couple of examples.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们来举几个例子。

segments.en: My husband was supposed to pick me up from work yesterday, but he forgot.
segments.cn: 我丈夫昨天本该来接我下班，但他忘了。

segments.en: All right, we'll have a talk with him.
Or we could also say, oh I need to hurry up.
segments.cn: 或者我们也可以说，哦，我得快点。

segments.en: The taxi will pick me up at seven.
segments.cn: 出租车会在七点来接我。

segments.en: And our final word in today's language takeaway is ordinary.
segments.cn: 今天语言要点的最后一个词是普通。

segments.en: So ordinary is a normal word.
segments.cn: 所以普通是一个正常的词。

segments.en: So you can have like an ordinary person.
segments.cn: 所以你可以有一个普通的人。

segments.en: An ordinary podcast, which English pod is not.
segments.cn: 一个普通的播客，而EnglishPod不是。

segments.en: And I guess now we can listen to our dialogue a This time it'll be a little bit slower, and this will help you to understand the language more clearly.
segments.cn: 我想现在我们可以听我们的对话。这次会慢一点，这将帮助你更清楚地理解语言。

segments.en: I'm so relieved that your ankle wasn't broken.
segments.cn: 我真松了一口气，你的脚踝没有骨折。

segments.en: I feel just awful about this whole thing.
segments.cn: 我对这整个事情感到非常糟糕。

segments.en: I want to make it up to you.
Let me take you out to dinner tonight.
Thank you for such a lovely evening.
segments.cn: 感谢你度过如此美好的夜晚。

segments.en: The food was amazing, and I had a great time.
segments.cn: 食物很美味，我度过了愉快的时光。

segments.en: I wish this night would never end.
segments.cn: 我希望这个夜晚永远不会结束。

segments.en: There's something I have to tell you.
I woke up today thinking this would be just like any other ordinary day.
segments.cn: 我今天醒来时以为这只是普通的一天。

segments.en: A twist of fate brought us together.
segments.cn: 命运的转折让我们相遇。

segments.en: I crashed into your life, and you into mine.
segments.cn: 我闯入了你的生活，你也闯入了我的。

segments.en: And this may sound crazy, but I'm falling in love with you, Veronica.
segments.cn: 这听起来可能很疯狂，但我爱上你了，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: Okay, so we looked at some great vocabulary, and now we can look at some great phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看了一些很棒的词汇，现在可以看看一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: So let's start with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么我们从流利构建器开始吧。

segments.en: On Fluency Builder today we have three great phrases, so why don't we just start with the first one?
segments.cn: 今天在流利构建器上我们有三个很棒的短语，为什么不先从第一个开始呢？

segments.en: Yeah, the first one we heard at the beginning of the dialogue.
segments.cn: 是的，第一个我们在对话开始时听到的。

segments.en: Okay, so we have some great examples on how we use make it up, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些很好的例子来展示如何使用“弥补”，所以我们来听听。

segments.en: I'm sorry I forgot your birthday.
segments.cn: 对不起，我忘了你的生日。

segments.en: How can I make it up to you?
I feel terrible for calling your mother fat.
segments.cn: 我为称呼你母亲胖感到很糟糕。

segments.en: I want to make it up to her, so I got her these flowers.
segments.cn: 我想弥补她，所以我给她买了这些花。
约翰又忘了我的纪念日。

segments.en: He's going to have to make it up to me.
We can see from the examples that when you use the phrase make it up to you, you're kind of saying you want to balance something bad you did with some good action, right?
segments.cn: 从这些例子中我们可以看到，当你使用短语“弥补你”时，你是在说你想用一些好的行为来平衡你做的坏事，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so if you call your mother-in-law fat, you better buy her at least some flowers or a card or something.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你称呼你的岳母胖，你最好给她买些花或卡片之类的东西。

segments.en: And the balancing good action was the flowers.
I don't think flowers will be enough though.
segments.cn: 不过我觉得花可能不够。

segments.en: Hmm, looks like a doomed marriage.
segments.cn: 嗯，看起来婚姻注定要失败。
好吧，我们的第二个短语。

segments.en: So we use this phrase when we want to say, I'll invite you, I'll pay for you.
segments.cn: 所以我们在想说“我请你，我为你付钱”时使用这个短语。

segments.en: Right, so I can say, hey let's go get some beers.
segments.cn: 对，所以我可以说，嘿，我们去喝点啤酒吧。

segments.en: And our last phrase for Fluency Builder, a twist of fate.
segments.cn: 我们流利构建器的最后一个短语，命运的转折。

segments.en: So Erica, what is a twist of fate?
segments.cn: 所以埃里卡，什么是命运的转折？

segments.en: A twist of fate is an unplanned event that has a big impact on your future or your life.
segments.cn: 命运的转折是一个未计划的事件，对你的未来或生活产生重大影响。

segments.en: Marco, can you give us an example of a twist of fate?
segments.cn: 马尔科，你能给我们一个命运的转折的例子吗？

segments.en: Okay, you're supposed to catch a flight to another country, alright?
segments.cn: 好吧，你本该赶上去另一个国家的航班，对吧？

segments.en: But you're late, so you miss your flight.
segments.cn: 但你迟到了，所以错过了航班。

segments.en: So that's a twist of fate.
segments.cn: 所以这就是命运的转折。

segments.en: So yeah, it's like, it's like fate, it's like destiny.
segments.cn: 所以是的，就像命运，就像宿命。

segments.en: You were, you weren't supposed to be on that flight.
segments.cn: 你本不该在那个航班上。

segments.en: Okay, so a twist of fate.
On a happier note, let's listen to the dialogue a third time.
segments.cn: 在更快乐的音符上，让我们第三次听对话。

segments.en: I'm so relieved that your ankle wasn't broken.
segments.cn: 我很高兴你的脚踝没有骨折。

segments.en: I feel just awful about this whole thing.
segments.cn: 我对此事感到非常糟糕。

segments.en: I want to make it up to you.
Let me take you out to dinner tonight.
Thank you for such a lovely evening.
segments.cn: 感谢你度过如此美好的夜晚。

segments.en: The food was amazing and I had a great time.
segments.cn: 食物很美味，我度过了愉快的时光。

segments.en: I wish this night would never end.
segments.cn: 我希望这个夜晚永远不会结束。

segments.en: There's something that I have to tell you.
I woke up today thinking that this would be just like any other day.
segments.cn: 我今天醒来时以为这只是普通的一天。

segments.en: Twist of fate brought us together.
segments.cn: 命运的转折让我们相遇。

segments.en: I crashed into your life and you into mine.
segments.cn: 我闯入了你的生活，你也闯入了我的。

segments.en: And this may sound crazy, but I'm falling in love with you, Veronica.
segments.cn: 这听起来可能很疯狂，但我爱上你了，维罗妮卡。

segments.en: Erica, I know you have a story of a twist of fate in your life.
segments.cn: 艾瑞卡，我知道你有一个命运转折的故事。
最近，确实发生了这样的事。

segments.en: I went to this party and at the party there was a contest, like sort of a lottery.
segments.cn: 我去参加一个派对，派对上有一个比赛，类似于抽奖。

segments.en: You could buy some tickets and win a prize.
segments.cn: 你可以买一些票赢得奖品。

segments.en: And the prize was a week-long vacation.
So I went with some friends of mine and they were tired.
segments.cn: 我和一些朋友一起去，他们很累。

segments.en: So they left early and they gave me their tickets.
segments.cn: 所以他们早早离开，把票给了我。
我们赢得了一周的假期。

segments.en: So that was a really lucky twist of fate for me.
segments.cn: 所以这对我来说是一个非常幸运的命运转折。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm sure it wasn't that good of a twist of fate for your friends.
segments.cn: 是的，我敢肯定这对你的朋友来说并不是那么好的命运转折。

segments.en: Yeah, but they were very generous and let me have the prize anyway.
segments.cn: 是的，但他们非常慷慨，还是让我得到了奖品。

segments.en: Alright, well we want to hear your stories of maybe some type of twist of fate that you've had.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们想听听你们的故事，可能是你们经历过的某种命运转折。

segments.en: Maybe love stories, maybe tragic stories, any story.
segments.cn: 也许是爱情故事，也许是悲惨故事，任何故事。

segments.en: So be sure to leave your questions and comments and your stories at our website EnglishPod.com and where you can also find us to answer any questions or doubts.
segments.cn: 所以请务必在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 留下你的问题、评论和故事，我们也会在那儿回答任何问题或疑虑。

segments.en: So I guess until then it's goodbye.
segments.cn: 所以我想在那之前就再见了。
